intro: Stichorkis rhombea, commonly known as the diamondleaf shrub, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its small, rhombus-shaped leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salty air and drought conditions. Stichorkis rhombea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
